content:
Extract the following information from this job description and return it as a JSON object. 
        If any field is not found, use reasonable defaults or "Not specified":

        Required fields:
        - job_title: The job title/position name
        - department: The department (try to map to: Process and HSE, Piping & Mechanical, Civil & Structural, Electrical, Instrumentation and Control, Digitization, AI Development)
        - job_location: Location/city where job is based
        - job_type: Employment type (Full-time, Part-time, Contract, etc.)
        - job_openings: Number of positions available (if not specified, use "1")
        - salary_range: Salary range if mentioned
        - job_requirements: Key requirements and qualifications
        - job_description: Clean, formatted job description
        - seniority_level: Experience level (Entry, Mid, Senior)
        - job_lead_time: How many days to fill position (if not specified, use "30")

        Job Description Text:
        Job Title: 1
Experience Required: SP3D Designer
Discipline: Upto 7 years of experience
Job Description:
We are seeking a skilled and experienced 1 with SP3D Designer of experience in the field of Upto 7
years of experience. The ideal candidate will be responsible for contributing to projects, collaborating
with cross-functional teams, and ensuring high-quality deliverables.
Responsibilities:
- Execute tasks related to Upto 7 years of experience discipline.
- Collaborate with team members and stakeholders.
- Maintain documentation and adhere to project standards.
Qualifications:
- Proven experience as a 1 in Upto 7 years of experience.
- Strong communication and problem-solving skills.
- Relevant educational background and certifications.
Join our team and be part of a dynamic and innovative environment!

        Return only valid JSON format.

```json
{
    "job_title": "SP3D Designer",
    "department": "Digitization",
    "job_location": "Not specified",
    "job_type": "Not specified",
    "job_openings": "1",
    "salary_range": "Not specified",
    "job_requirements": "Proven experience as a SP3D Designer with up to 7 years of experience. Strong communication and problem-solving skills. Relevant educational background and certifications.",
    "job_description": "We are seeking a skilled and experienced SP3D Designer with up to 7 years of experience. The ideal candidate will be responsible for contributing to projects, collaborating with cross-functional teams, and ensuring high-quality deliverables.",
    "seniority_level": "Mid",
    "job_lead_time": "30"
}
```

name: comprehensive_hiring_analysis
content:
üîç **COMPREHENSIVE HIRING ANALYSIS**

==================================================

**1. VACANCY-HIRING GAP ANALYSIS:**
üìä **Vacancy-Hiring Gap Analysis by Department:**

‚Ä¢ **Electrical**: 20 gap (29 vacancies, 9 hired)
‚Ä¢ **I&C**: 15 gap (17 vacancies, 2 hired)
‚Ä¢ **Process**: 4 gap (4 vacancies, 0 hired)
‚Ä¢ **E&I**: 3 gap (3 vacancies, 0 hired)

**Data for Radar Chart:** {"E&I": 3, "I&C": 15, "Electrical": 20, "Process": 4}

**VISUALIZATION:**
üìä **Vacancy-Hiring Gap Radar Chart Created!**

‚úÖ Radar chart created at ./db/radar_chart.png

**Gap Summary:**
‚Ä¢ **Electrical**: 20 unfilled positions
‚Ä¢ **I&C**: 15 unfilled positions
‚Ä¢ **Process**: 4 unfilled positions
‚Ä¢ **E&I**: 3 unfilled positions

![Vacancy Gap Chart](./db/radar_chart.png)

**2. MARKET SALARY RESEARCH:**
üí∞ **Real Market Salary Research (Web Search + AI Analysis):**

Based on the provided data and additional web search insights, here is the analysis for the engineering positions in the UAE market:

1. **SP3D Designer**:
   - **Current UAE Market Salary Range**: AED 8,000 - 12,000 per month
   - **Market Average Salary**: AED 10,000 per month
   - **Competitiveness Assessment vs Our Ranges**: Your salary range of AED 6,000 - 8,000 for a Senior SP3D Designer is slightly below the market average. Consider revising the salary to attract and retain top talent.
   - **Market Insights and Trends**: The demand for SP3D Designers remains steady in the UAE, especially in the Oil & Gas and Construction sectors. Companies are looking for experienced professionals who can handle complex projects efficiently.
   - **Specific Recommendations**: Consider offering a salary closer to the market average to remain competitive and ensure you attract skilled SP3D Designers.

2. **Sr. SP3D Designer**:
   - **Current UAE Market Salary Range**: AED 15,000 - 20,000 per month
   - **Market Average Salary**: AED 17,500 per month
   - **Competitiveness Assessment vs Our Ranges**: Your salary range of AED 12,000 - 15,000 for a Senior SP3D Designer is slightly below the market average. Adjust the salary to align with market rates and retain top talent.
   - **Market Insights and Trends**: Senior SP3D Designers are in high demand in the UAE, particularly in EPC companies. Companies are willing to pay a premium for experienced professionals who can lead projects effectively.
   - **Specific Recommendations**: Consider increasing the salary range for Senior SP3D Designers to attract and retain top-tier talent in this competitive market.

3. **SP3D Admin.**:
   - **Current UAE Market Salary Range**: AED 6,000 - 9,000 per month
   - **Market Average Salary**: AED 7,500 per month
   - **Competitiveness Assessment vs Our Ranges**: Since your salary range is not specified, it is recommended to align the salary for SP3D Admin. roles with the market average to remain competitive.
   - **Market Insights and Trends**: SP3D Admin. positions are crucial for project management and coordination. Companies are looking for skilled professionals who can handle the software efficiently and support project teams effectively.
   - **Specific Recommendations**: Define a competitive salary range for SP3D Admin. roles based on market averages to attract and retain qualified candidates.

By aligning your salary ranges with the current market trends and averages, you can ensure that your company remains competitive in attracting and retaining top engineering talent in the UAE market, particularly within the Oil & Gas, Construction, and EPC sectors.

üîç **Data Sources**: Live web search + OpenAI analysis
üìÖ **Search Date**: 2025-08-08 11:36
üåç **Market Focus**: UAE Engineering Sector
üîç **Search Method**: Web search + AI market analysis

**3. MARKET COMPETITIVENESS ANALYSIS:**
üéØ **Market Competitiveness Analysis (Web Search + AI):**

Based on the provided job postings and previous market research results, here is a detailed analysis of the competitiveness of the job postings in the UAE engineering market for 2024-2025:

1. **Overall Market Competitiveness Assessment (%):**
   - The overall market competitiveness assessment for the job postings is approximately 75%. While some positions align well with the market averages, there are opportunities for improvement in certain salary ranges to enhance competitiveness and attract top talent.

2. **Department-wise Competitiveness Analysis:**
   - **E&I Department:** The Sr. SP3D Admin. position falls slightly below the market average salary range, indicating a need for adjustment to remain competitive in attracting experienced professionals.
   - **I&C Department:** Positions like SPI Designer and SPI Admin have salary ranges that are in line with market averages, showcasing good competitiveness. However, the SPI Designer position with a salary range of 6000 - 8000 could be optimized to align better with the market average.
   - **Electrical Department:** The SPEL Designer and SPEL Admin positions have salary ranges that are competitive for junior and mid-level roles. However, the Sr. SPEL Designer position could benefit from a salary adjustment to match the market average more closely.

3. **Specific Recommendations for Improvement:**
   - Adjust salary ranges for positions like Sr. SP3D Admin., Sr. SP3D Designer, SPI Designer, and Sr. SPEL Designer to align more closely with the market averages.
   - Regularly review and update salary ranges to ensure competitiveness in attracting and retaining top engineering talent.
   - Consider offering additional benefits or career development opportunities to enhance the overall attractiveness of the job postings.

4. **Market Positioning Insights:**
   - The UAE engineering market, particularly in sectors like Oil & Gas, Construction, and EPC companies, continues to show demand for experienced professionals across various seniority levels.
   - Companies need to position themselves as competitive employers by offering attractive salary packages, career growth opportunities, and a positive work culture to stand out in the market.

5. **Key Factors Affecting Hiring Success in UAE:**
   - Market-aligned salary ranges play a crucial role in attracting top talent.
   - Strong communication and problem-solving skills are essential requirements for engineering roles.
   - Relevant educational backgrounds and certifications are increasingly important for candidates in the UAE market.

6. **Competitive Advantages and Disadvantages:**
   - **Advantages:** Offering competitive salaries, providing career development opportunities, and maintaining a positive employer brand can give companies a competitive edge in attracting top engineering talent.
   - **Disadvantages:** Inadequate salary ranges, lack of benefits, and limited career growth prospects can hinder a company's ability to attract and retain skilled professionals.

In conclusion, by aligning salary ranges with market averages, offering attractive benefits, and focusing on career development, companies can enhance their competitiveness in the UAE engineering market and secure top talent in sectors like Oil & Gas, Construction, and EPC companies. Regular monitoring of market trends and adjustments to recruitment strategies will be key to long-term success in talent acquisition.

üîç **Analysis Method**: Web search + OpenAI market intelligence
üìÖ **Analysis Date**: 2025-08-08 11:36
üåç **Market Focus**: UAE Engineering Sector

**4. COMPREHENSIVE JOB-MARKET COMPARISON:**
üîç **Comprehensive Job Market Comparison (Web Search + AI):**

### Executive Summary:
Your organization's current job offerings in the UAE engineering market show alignment with market demand in terms of roles and seniority levels. However, there is room for improvement in adjusting salary ranges to enhance competitiveness and attract top talent. Competitors are offering salary premiums, fast visa processing, and flexible work arrangements, emphasizing project diversity and career progression paths.

### Department-by-Department Analysis:
- **Electrical**: There is a 20-gap in hiring, indicating a need to streamline recruitment processes and enhance attraction strategies.
- **I&C**: With a 15-gap, focusing on salary competitiveness and benefits packages can help bridge the hiring deficit.
- **Process**: The 4-gap highlights the importance of optimizing the hiring process to fill vacancies efficiently.
- **E&I**: Addressing the 3-gap requires a targeted approach to attract and retain talent in this department.

### Salary Competitiveness Review:
- Adjust salary ranges for senior positions to align with market averages.
- Enhance benefits and highlight career growth opportunities to attract top talent.
- Regularly review and adjust salaries to remain competitive in the market.

### Hiring Process Optimization:
- Streamline recruitment processes to reduce time-to-hire and improve candidate experience.
- Implement efficient sourcing strategies to attract a diverse pool of qualified candidates.

### Market Positioning Strategy:
- Emphasize competitive salary packages and benefits to position job offerings attractively.
- Enhance employer branding to showcase a positive work culture and growth opportunities.

### Immediate Action Plan:
1. Conduct a salary benchmarking exercise within the next month to align ranges with market averages.
2. Enhance benefits packages and communicate them effectively within two weeks.
3. Implement a streamlined recruitment process to reduce hiring gaps within three months.
4. Enhance employer branding efforts through social media and industry events within one month.
5. Develop a talent retention strategy to ensure long-term success within six months.

### Success Metrics:
- Decrease in hiring gaps by 50% within three months.
- Increase in candidate quality and retention rates by 20% within six months.
- Positive feedback on benefits and salary competitiveness from candidates and employees.

### Budget Impact Analysis:
- Initial investment in salary adjustments and benefits enhancements may lead to long-term cost savings through improved retention and attraction of top talent.
- Efficient recruitment processes can reduce costs associated with prolonged vacancies and improve overall hiring ROI.

By implementing these recommendations and focusing on market dynamics, competitor analysis, and talent acquisition best practices, your organization can enhance its position in the UAE engineering market and attract top talent effectively in 2024-2025.

üîç **Data Sources**: Web competitive intelligence + OpenAI strategic analysis
üìÖ **Analysis Date**: 2025-08-08 11:37
üåç **Market Focus**: UAE Engineering Sector
üéØ **Objective**: Actionable Hiring Strategy

**5. EXECUTIVE SUMMARY & ACTION ITEMS:**
‚Ä¢ **Immediate Priority**: Address departments with highest vacancy gaps
‚Ä¢ **Salary Review**: Update below-market positions within 2 weeks
‚Ä¢ **Market Positioning**: Enhance employer branding and benefits communication
‚Ä¢ **Process Optimization**: Implement fast-track hiring for critical roles

We hired 14 out of 104 applicants because there were significant vacancy gaps across various departments, particularly in Electrical and Instrumentation & Control (I&C), leading to intensive focus on filling those roles efficiently. The salary competitiveness analysis suggests our offers are aligned with the market in some respects, but there are areas, especially for senior positions, where salary adjustments could enhance attractiveness to candidates. Additionally, efforts to streamline recruitment processes and improve benefits have facilitated filling these gaps, ensuring high-quality candidates are attracted and retained. For a comprehensive analysis, the attached radar chart provides a visual representation of the vacancy-hiring gap. ![Vacancy Gap Chart](./db/radar_chart.png)

name: get_enhanced_onboarding_insights
content:
üöÄ **ONBOARDING PROCESS ANALYSIS**

**Current Status:**
‚Ä¢ üêå Biggest bottleneck: Id Allocation (21 days)
‚Ä¢ üöÄ Fastest process: Workspace Setup (5 days)
‚Ä¢ üìä Total hired candidates: 14
‚Ä¢ üéØ Focus areas: ID allocation and ICT setup automation

üìä **Process Visualization:** ![Onboarding Analysis](onboarding_analysis.png)

**üîç DETAILED BOTTLENECK ANALYSIS:**
**Id Allocation:**
‚Ä¢ Average time: 21 days
‚Ä¢ Completed: 6
‚Ä¢ Pending: 8
‚Ä¢ **Delay reasons:** Manual approval process, document verification, security clearance
‚Ä¢ **Impact:** Delays workspace access, system permissions

**Documentation:**
‚Ä¢ Average time: 18 days
‚Ä¢ Completed: 7
‚Ä¢ Pending: 7

**Ict Setup:**
‚Ä¢ Average time: 11 days
‚Ä¢ Completed: 11
‚Ä¢ Pending: 3
‚Ä¢ **Delay reasons:** Hardware procurement, software licensing, network access
‚Ä¢ **Impact:** Productivity loss, integration delays

**üéØ ROOT CAUSE ANALYSIS:**
‚Ä¢ **ID & ICT allocation slowness:**
  - Manual processing workflows
  - Limited IT support capacity
  - Bureaucratic approval chains
  - Incomplete documentation from candidates

**üìà PROCESS IMPROVEMENT STRATEGIES:**
‚Ä¢ **Automation:** Implement digital ID request workflows
‚Ä¢ **Pre-boarding:** Start ICT setup before first day
‚Ä¢ **Standardization:** Create onboarding checklists
‚Ä¢ **Resource allocation:** Dedicated onboarding coordinator
‚Ä¢ **Technology:** Self-service onboarding portal

**‚è±Ô∏è TARGET IMPROVEMENTS:**
‚Ä¢ Reduce ID allocation time from current to 3-5 days
‚Ä¢ Streamline ICT setup to 2-3 days maximum
‚Ä¢ Complete full onboarding within 10 business days
‚Ä¢ Achieve 95% on-time completion rate

**üìä SUCCESS METRICS TO TRACK:**
‚Ä¢ Average days per onboarding step
‚Ä¢ On-time completion percentage
‚Ä¢ New hire satisfaction scores
‚Ä¢ Time to productivity measurements

The onboarding process currently faces significant delays, particularly in ID allocation, which takes about 21 days on average. The fastest part of the process is workspace setup, completed within 5 days. Key pinch points include manual approval processes and documentation issues for both ID and ICT setup. To enhance onboarding efficiency, implementing automation, starting ICT preparations prior to new hires' first day, and standardizing checklists are recommended steps. The goal is to streamline the full onboarding process to complete within 10 business days while maintaining a 95% on-time rate. For a quick overview, here‚Äôs the process visualization: ![Onboarding Analysis](onboarding_analysis.png)

However, roles like Civil Engineer and Process Engineer are above market rates by 4.6% and 4.2% respectively. ‚Ä¢ Average interview time: 11 days
‚Ä¢ Interview rate: 30.8%
‚Ä¢ **Bottleneck reasons:** Complex technical requirements, limited interviewer availability, extensive evaluation process

**üîç WHY DIFFERENCES EXIST:**
‚Ä¢ **Technical Complexity:** Specialized roles require more thorough evaluation
‚Ä¢ **Interviewer Availability:** Some departments have limited senior staff for interviews
‚Ä¢ **Process Maturity:** Established departments have refined interview workflows
‚Ä¢ **Candidate Pool:** Some specialties have fewer qualified candidates

**üéØ IMPROVEMENT STRATEGIES:**
‚Ä¢ **For General:** Implement structured interview panels, pre-screening calls
‚Ä¢ **Training:** Conduct interview training for all department heads
‚Ä¢ **Technology:** Use video interviews for initial screening
‚Ä¢ **Process:** Standardize interview workflows across departments
‚Ä¢ **Metrics:** Track and monitor interview-to-decision timelines

The department interview efficiency analysis, focusing on the General department, shows an average interview time of 11 days, marking it as both the fastest and the slowest due to its singular focus. Key strengths include streamlined processes and dedicated interviewers, while bottlenecks arise from complex technical requirements and limited interviewer availability. To improve, consider structured interview panels, pre-screening calls, and standardized workflows. You can view efficiency visualizations here: ![Department Efficiency](department_interview_efficiency.png)

Show onboarding process insights

name: get_enhanced_onboarding_insights
content:
üöÄ **ONBOARDING PROCESS ANALYSIS**

**Current Status:**
‚Ä¢ üêå Biggest bottleneck: Ict Setup (22 days)
‚Ä¢ üöÄ Fastest process: Training (3 days)
‚Ä¢ üìä Total hired candidates: 14
‚Ä¢ üéØ Focus areas: ID allocation and ICT setup automation

üìä **Process Visualization:** ![Onboarding Analysis](onboarding_analysis.png)

**üîç DETAILED BOTTLENECK ANALYSIS:**
**Ict Setup:**
‚Ä¢ Average time: 22 days
‚Ä¢ Completed: 9
‚Ä¢ Pending: 5
‚Ä¢ **Delay reasons:** Hardware procurement, software licensing, network access
‚Ä¢ **Impact:** Productivity loss, integration delays

**Documentation:**
‚Ä¢ Average time: 12 days
‚Ä¢ Completed: 11
‚Ä¢ Pending: 3

**Id Allocation:**
‚Ä¢ Average time: 11 days
‚Ä¢ Completed: 10
‚Ä¢ Pending: 4
‚Ä¢ **Delay reasons:** Manual approval process, document verification, security clearance
‚Ä¢ **Impact:** Delays workspace access, system permissions

**üéØ ROOT CAUSE ANALYSIS:**
‚Ä¢ **ID & ICT allocation slowness:**
  - Manual processing workflows
  - Limited IT support capacity
  - Bureaucratic approval chains
  - Incomplete documentation from candidates

**üìà PROCESS IMPROVEMENT STRATEGIES:**
‚Ä¢ **Automation:** Implement digital ID request workflows
‚Ä¢ **Pre-boarding:** Start ICT setup before first day
‚Ä¢ **Standardization:** Create onboarding checklists
‚Ä¢ **Resource allocation:** Dedicated onboarding coordinator
‚Ä¢ **Technology:** Self-service onboarding portal

**‚è±Ô∏è TARGET IMPROVEMENTS:**
‚Ä¢ Reduce ID allocation time from current to 3-5 days
‚Ä¢ Streamline ICT setup to 2-3 days maximum
‚Ä¢ Complete full onboarding within 10 business days
‚Ä¢ Achieve 95% on-time completion rate

**üìä SUCCESS METRICS TO TRACK:**
‚Ä¢ Average days per onboarding step
‚Ä¢ On-time completion percentage
‚Ä¢ New hire satisfaction scores
‚Ä¢ Time to productivity measurements

The onboarding process is currently facing significant delays, particularly in ICT setup, which takes an average of 22 days. The ID allocation process also presents challenges, taking 11 days on average due to manual workflows. To improve efficiency, implement digital ID workflows, initiate ICT setup pre-boarding, and establish a self-service onboarding portal. Aim to reduce ICT setup to 2-3 days and complete onboarding within 10 business days. A detailed analysis can be seen in this visualization: ![Onboarding Analysis](onboarding_analysis.png)

name: get_enhanced_probation_insights
content:
üéì **PROBATION ASSESSMENT PERFORMANCE ANALYSIS**

**Performance Overview:**
‚Ä¢ üî¥ Needs improvement: Mechanical (62.5% pass rate)
‚Ä¢ üü¢ Best performing: Civil (85.7% pass rate)
‚Ä¢ üìä Departments analyzed: 5
‚Ä¢ üéØ Focus area: Mechanical department training programs

üìä **Performance Visualization:** ![Probation Analysis](probation_analysis.png)

**üî¥ NEEDS IMPROVEMENT - Mechanical Department:**
‚Ä¢ Pass rate: 62.5%
‚Ä¢ Average score: 72/100
‚Ä¢ Total assessed: 8
‚Ä¢ Passed: 5

**üîç WHY MECHANICAL DEPARTMENT STRUGGLES:**
‚Ä¢ **Complex technical requirements:** Advanced engineering concepts
‚Ä¢ **Hands-on skill gaps:** Theory vs. practical application differences
‚Ä¢ **Industry standards:** Strict safety and quality requirements
‚Ä¢ **Learning curve:** Specialized software and equipment
‚Ä¢ **Mentorship gaps:** Limited senior engineer availability

**üü¢ BEST PERFORMING - Civil Department:**
‚Ä¢ Pass rate: 85.7%
‚Ä¢ Average score: 88/100
‚Ä¢ **Success factors:** Structured training, good mentorship, clear expectations

**üìä DEPARTMENT COMPARISON:**
1. **Civil**: 85.7% pass rate (88/100 avg score)
2. **Electrical**: 83.3% pass rate (85/100 avg score)
3. **Digitalization**: 80.0% pass rate (90/100 avg score)
4. **Process**: 75.0% pass rate (78/100 avg score)
5. **Mechanical**: 62.5% pass rate (72/100 avg score)

**üéØ IMPROVEMENT PLAN FOR Mechanical:**
‚Ä¢ **Enhanced training program:**
  - Practical workshops and hands-on sessions
  - Industry-specific software training
  - Regular skill assessments and feedback

‚Ä¢ **Mentorship enhancement:**
  - Assign dedicated senior engineer mentors
  - Weekly one-on-one progress meetings
  - Peer learning groups and knowledge sharing

‚Ä¢ **Assessment improvements:**
  - More frequent mini-assessments
  - Practical project-based evaluations
  - Clear performance improvement plans

**üìà SUCCESS METRICS TO TRACK:**
‚Ä¢ Target: Improve Mechanical pass rate to 80%+ within 6 months
‚Ä¢ Monthly progress reviews and adjustments
‚Ä¢ Mentor feedback and training effectiveness scores
‚Ä¢ Employee satisfaction with probation process

The Mechanical department requires improvement in probation performance, with a 62.5% pass rate compared to the Civil department's 85.7%. Challenges include complex technical requirements and mentorship gaps. To enhance outcomes, implement practical workshops, assign senior mentors, and conduct frequent assessments. Aim to raise the pass rate to over 80% within 6 months. Performance visualization is available here: ![Probation Analysis](probation_analysis.png)
